channel.title: Reset NPC
channel.description:
Hello! Im looking for a tutorial of how to make a ::resetnpc command.
I did not find anything when i searched. Can anyone create a tutorial for me?
Oh, the resetnpc command is supposed to make all npc die.

item.title: Reset NPC
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:12, topic:251602”][quote author=MoparScaperDude link=topic=332138.msg2595569#msg2595569 date=1229976329]
Lol, neat-freak much.
[/quote]

No not really, it is just the way it is suppose to be done. Stop being lazy, this community is only getting worse because people like you who attempt to know stuff; feed false information to people who are learning. Leading them into learning it that way and then spreading it to others, making the problem bigger and bigger and making the community looking bad. If you wish to help others, do it correctly. End of mini-speech[/quote]
Agreed.

Read full topic

item.title: Reset NPC
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“MoparScaperDude, post:6, topic:251602”]LOL @ Penguin.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("npcreset") && playerRights >=2) { for (int i = 0; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) { if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] != null) { server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = true; server.npcHandler.npcs[i].actionTimer = 0; } } PlayerHandler.messageToAll ="DryTears Server Message - Server NPC Reset By - " + playerName; }

You’re welcome.[/quote]

for (int i = 0; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) {

Why are you accessing a static object staticly? The value maxNPCs is static so there is no need to access it from a static context.

for (int i = 0; i < NPCHandler.maxNPCs; i++) {

Read full topic
